meanings.sent1: The strong wind overset the boat, causing it to capsize.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to overset the cup of water on the edge of the table.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy overset the bowl of food with a playful jump.
meanings.sent4: Her unexpected question overset his carefully prepared speech.
meanings.sent5: The sudden news overset her emotions, leaving her in shock.

meanings.definition: To set too much type for printing
meanings.sent1: I accidentally overset the document, making the text too small to read.
meanings.sent2: The printer warned me not to overset the layout to avoid printing errors.
meanings.sent3: The new intern overset the brochure, causing the text to be jumbled up.
meanings.sent4: The graphic designer overset the poster, cramming too much information into a small space.
meanings.sent5: The editor had to fix the overset text before sending it to print.

meanings.definition: An excessive amount of type set for printing
meanings.sent1: The overset in the newspaper caused confusion among the readers.
meanings.sent2: The book had an overset of text on every page, making it hard to read.
meanings.sent3: The magazine layout had an overset of images, making it visually overwhelming.
meanings.sent4: The flyer had an overset of information, making it look cluttered.
meanings.sent5: The poster's overset of text made it difficult to focus on the main message.
